alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Wrangell (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 6:17AM AKST until December 24 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. The first band on Friday will start with light, dry, snow tracking northward across the area. The snow will become wetter over the southern panhandle. A break or decrease in snowfall rates will occur before the second frontal band tracks northward into the southern panhandle early Saturday. This front will bring another round of snow and a chance of freezing rain. The south will change to all rain while the north sees snow tapering off or mixing with freezing rain Saturday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected and light freezing rain possible. Storm total snow accumulation of 7 to 10 inches. * WHERE...City and Borough of Wrangell. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Possible power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Greatest snowfall rates expected during the daytime Friday and again Saturday morning. A period of light freezing rain is possible Saturday before a change over to all rain.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
